name: A. Lunch Rush
statement:
Having written another programming contest, three Rabbits decided to
grab some lunch. The coach gave the team exactly time units for the
lunch break.The Rabbits have a list of restaurants to lunch in: the -th
restaurant is characterized by two integers and . Value shows the time
the Rabbits need to lunch in the -th restaurant. If time exceeds the
time that the coach has given for the lunch break, then the Rabbits’ joy
from lunching in this restaurant will equal . Otherwise, the Rabbits get
exactly units of joy.Your task is to find the value of the maximum joy
the Rabbits can get from the lunch, depending on the restaurant. The
Rabbits must choose one restaurant to lunch in. Note that the joy value
isn’t necessarily a positive value.
editorial:
Let s look at all restraunts, where Rabbits can have their lunch. Let s
calculate the answer for all restraunts and choose the maximulm value
among of them. We need to use formula descrbed in problem statement to
calculate the answer for some particular restraunt. Time complexity of
this solution is . C++ code Java code
